content.title: Carotid Endarterectomy Surgical Technique
content.definition: Standard surgical technique for carotid endarterectomy including approach, arteriotomy, plaque removal, and closure options.

concepts.definition: Surgical exposure of the carotid bifurcation via longitudinal incision anterior to sternocleidomastoid muscle.

clinical_features.incision: Anterior border of SCM following skin crease

concepts.definition: Longitudinal arteriotomy from CCA across bulb into ICA with circumferential dissection of plaque in subintimal plane.
Temporary internal shunt placement to maintain cerebral perfusion during carotid clamping.
Options for arteriotomy closure including primary closure and patch angioplasty.

clinical_features.primary_closure: Acceptable if artery >5mm, no evidence of residual stenosis
clinical_features.patch_advantage: Reduced restenosis and perioperative stroke rates
